title: Sick man 'force-feeds strong alcoholic spirits to shaking cat until it dies'

Horrifying footage shows a man seemingly force-feeding strong alcoholic spirits to a shaking cat - which later died.

The sick video has sparked outrage, with calls for those behind it to be severely punished.

It was reportedly filmed in the city of Yogyakarta in south-west Indonesia.

The sickening clip was shared on Twitter by a user named jmesbryan, who wrote: "Help make this go viral so the b****** can be arrested."

According to local media, one suspect, identified as university student A.A.H, is under investigation despite at least one other person being present behind the camera.

(Image: AsiaWire/@jmesbryant)

(Image: AsiaWire/@jmesbryant)

In the disturbing footage, the sodden, trembling cat is seen being force fed a blue-tinted liquid which police believe was fermented sugarcane liquor.

The sick culprit continually pours the liquid down the shaking cat's throat until it stops moving and appears dead.

According to local media, Doni Herdaru Tona of the organisation Animal Defenders Indonesia was made aware of the video and vowed to file a complaint with the police.

(Image: AsiaWire/@jmesbryant)

The Yoguakarta Police have confirmed they are investigating the incident.

Main suspect A.A.H. attends university in Yogyakarta and lives above a cafe close to where the cat died, but he has since returned to his hometown of Tulungagung, according to local media.

Indonesia has limited animal welfare regulations by international standards, but some cases can be punishable by up to nine months in prison, according to reports.

The police investigation is ongoing. It is unclear if any arrests have been made.
description: WARNING: DISTRESSING CONTENT Police are investigating after shocking footage was reportedly taken in Yogyakarta in south-west Indonesia
